TextBody: Hi Xuan, Thank you for getting back to me. I will wait on your update with the logs. Kind regards __________________ André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption www.endpointprotector.com This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval. ************************************************************************************************************************************************* --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com] Sent: 10/31/2024 9:52 AM To: lamvuong@kms-technology.com Cc: xuantnguyen@kms-technology.com Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420924 - - 00420924 - Endpoint Protector administrator webpage [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FiBf4:ref ] Hi Lam, For this we will need to review the logs captured while this issue is reproduced, where it creates event logs with count 1 while the CAP Policy is set to threshold of 10. We have the screenshots but will also need the logs to have a look and see what is actually happening on the client. Can you enable the debug logging and reproduce the issue, uploaded the logs to the EPP Server, then download them from the UI and send it to us please? You can use the attached step by step guide "How to enable and collect Debug Logs from Endpoint Protector Client v1.3.pdf" on how to collect the logs (artifact). Kind regards __________________ André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption www.endpointprotector.com This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval. ************************************************************************************************************************************************* --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Lam Vuong [lamvuong@kms-technology.com] Sent: 10/31/2024 3:25 AM To: techsupport@netwrix.com Cc: xuantnguyen@kms-technology.com Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420924 - - 00420924 - Endpoint Protector administrator webpage [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FiBf4:ref ] ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FiBf4:ref Hi André, How about the false positive with the records count to 1 while the threshold is setting to 10? Thanks and Best Regard, ___________________________________________________________________________________ Lam Vuong Senior IT Engineer Mobile: (+84) 090 911 2748 Google Chat: LamVuong Address: 2 Tan Vien St., W.2, Tan Binh Dist., HCMC On Wed, Oct 30, 2024 at 5:45 PM Netwrix Support wrote: Hi Xuan, Is your organization making use of GitHub Client? if you don't use this application then you can block the application completely and prevent it from running by adding it to the applications denylist this way the application won't be a risk as an exit point for data leakage. If you are using it for only some users then you can create a CAP policy to block the application for the users who don't need it and use a separate CAP policy for users that do need to use the application. If you are using Github Client and you are only accessing Git repositories over "https", then you can use DPI + the "Restricted Apps" feature: Kind regards __________________ André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption www.endpointprotector.com This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval. ************************************************************************************************************************************************* --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Xuan Thanh Nguyen [xuantnguyen@kms-technology.com] Sent: 10/30/2024 10:02 AM To: techsupport@netwrix.com Cc: lamvuong@kms-technology.com Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420924 - - 00420924 - Endpoint Protector administrator webpage [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FiBf4:ref ] ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FiBf4:ref Hi André, I deselected GitHub Client as per your suggestion. Let's wait to see its efficiency. In the meantime, may I ask how we can control the DLP on GitHub Client if it is deselected? Do you have other best practices for GitHub Client? Regards, Xuan On Mon, Oct 28, 2024 at 9:26?PM Netwrix Support wrote: Hi Xuan, The feedback that I got after discussing this case with our Dev team is that the "Github Client" is the reason behind the thousands of CAP event logs / entries. The Github application will report all files that are touched by the application even though they are not actually transferred anywhere. The Github application usually works with user files, it's not just opening it's application files and as a result it creates a lot of false positives as it "touches" various of files that contain source code. The first suggestion made is to deselect "GitHub Client" under "Cloud Services / File Sharing" as shown in the below screenshot, can you try to deselect it and observe if you are still getting a huge number of event logs under Content Aware Report and let us know please? Kind regards __________________ André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption www.endpointprotector.com This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval. ************************************************************************************************************************************************* --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Xuan Thanh Nguyen [xuantnguyen@kms-technology.com] Sent: 10/28/2024 9:09 AM To: techsupport@netwrix.com Cc: lamvuong@kms-technology.com Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420924 - - 00420924 - Endpoint Protector administrator webpage [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FiBf4:ref ] ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FiBf4:ref Hi Andre, Do you have any updates? Regards, Xuan On Thu, Oct 17, 2024 at 2:51?PM Xuan Thanh Nguyen wrote: Hi Andre, Thank you, see you tomorrow! Regards, Xuan On Thu, Oct 17, 2024 at 2:35?PM Netwrix Support wrote: Hi Xuan, Thank you for getting back to me, I have scheduled a remote session for 2 PM GMT+7 tomorrow. The calendar invitation was sent to you. Join Zoom Meeting https://netwrix.zoom.us/j/85208824844?pwd=XrefdcdubVxSsxt0Xv7HnMFPEugmt4.1 Kind regards __________________ André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption www.endpointprotector.com This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval. ************************************************************************************************************************************************* --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Xuan Thanh Nguyen [xuantnguyen@kms-technology.com] Sent: 10/17/2024 6:50 AM To: techsupport@netwrix.com Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420924 - - 00420924 - Endpoint Protector administrator webpage [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FiBf4:ref ] ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FiBf4:ref Hi Andre, Sorry for the late reply. Can we have a remote session at 14:00 on 18 Oct (GMT+7)? I need your help to perform a health check on my EPP server to identify any improvements we can make for better operation. Regards, Xuan On Tue, Oct 15, 2024 at 8:39?PM Netwrix Support wrote: Hi Xuan, I'm sorry to hear this, can we have a remote session this Friday to look at your EPP Server appliance? please let me know your availability. Can you give me some recommendations to improve its performance? Regards, Xuan On Mon, Oct 14, 2024 at 11:38?PM Netwrix Support wrote: Hello Xuan, I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00420924. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue. If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end. Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products. Currently, the webpage is accessible at https://epp.kms-technology.com/. Is it possible to modify the URL to https://epp.kms-technology.com:4443 ? Regards, Xuan Thank you!
